text: William John "Bill" Bennett (born July 31, 1943) is an American politician. He was the third United States Secretary of Education. He was in Ronald Reagan's cabinet. He served from February 1985 through September 1988. From 1989 to 1990, he served as the first Director of the Office of National Drug Control Policy. Bennett was born in Brooklyn, New York. He studied at Williams College, at the University of Texas-Austin, and at Harvard Law School. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1943 births Category:Living people Category:United States Secretaries of Education Category:Directors of the Office of National Drug Control Policy Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:Politicians from New York City Category:Chairpersons of the National Endowment for the Humanities
title: William Bennett
